oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville sit-in commemoration poster
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Middle Tennessee State University Student Programming Ideas and Issues Committee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A poster announcing the 25th anniversary of the Nashville Sit-in Movement on April 16, 1985. The University was showing a screening of the 1960 news documentary "Sit-in: ABC White Paper" at the Learning Resources Center on campus

As a tribute to Senator Avon Williams Middle Tennessee
State University presents An Unfinished Agenda don't serve n-censored here Nashville 1960 Commemorating the 25th anniversary of the Nashville
Sit-in Movement April 16,1985, 7:30 p.m. in the Multi-media Room of the Learning Resources
Center Middle Tennessee State University,
Murfreesboro, Tennessee A screening of the 1960 news documentary Sit-in: An
NBC White Paper, on the Nashville sit-ins fea-uring
the late Rev. Kelley Miller Smith, Nashville Mayor Ben
West, and NBC correspondent Chet Huntley. Director and
executive producer of the documentary was Wallace
Westfeldt. A response to the film featuring other persons in the
documentary and/or the Movement including John Lewis,
Atlanta councilman; C.T. Vivian, chairman of the
National Anti-Klan Network; A.Z. Kelley, Nashville
businessman and civic leader; George Barrett,
Nashville attorney and political consultant; and Roy
B.J. Campbelle, MTSU Professor of Criminal Justice
Administration, will be moderated by Westfeldt. Contact Prof. James Neal, 898-2300, ext. 2632 for
further information. This program is funded by the MTSU Student Programming
Ideas and Issues Committee, Public Service Committee,
Department of History, and the James N. Leonard fund
for the Promotion of Racial Understanding.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Demonstrations; Nashville (Tenn.); Civil rights--United States;
Commemorations;
